summary: This document appears to be a daily log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated August 9, 2019. It records various inmate movements, status changes, and administrative actions, including entries related to Jeffrey Epstein, who was incarcerated there at the time. The log is significant as it captures activity on the day before Epstein's death.

events.title: MCC Daily Log Activity
events.description: Administrative log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center recording inmate movements, status changes (like bail/bond, removal, release), and other entries throughout the day.

keyFacts: The document is a daily administrative log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York for August 9, 2019.
The log records various inmate status codes and movements, including entries for bail/bond, removal, release, and administrative changes.
The date of the log (August 9, 2019) is the day before Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the MCC on August 10, 2019.
The document is part of the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) SENTRY system, indicating it is an official prison record.
No specific individuals are named in the provided text; entries use alphanumeric codes (e.g., E09-568u, K01-001L, Z06-217UAD).
